snippet: Extreme cold and heavy snow buried parts of Europe over the last few days, claiming hundreds of lives, straining utilities and snarling transportation.
abstract: Extreme cold and heavy snow overtake parts of Europe, claiming the lives of hundreds of people, including many homeless in Eastern Europe, straining utilities and snarling transportation around the continent.

byline.original: By SARAH MASLIN NIR and ELISABETTA POVOLEDO
byline.contributor: Sarah Maslin Nir reported from New York, and Elisabetta Povoledo from Rome.

lead_paragraph: Extreme cold and heavy snow buried parts of Europe over the last few days, claiming hundreds of lives, straining utilities and snarling transportation.

headline.main: Hundreds of Deaths as Europe Struggles With Snow Amid an Intense Cold Snap
headline.print_headline: Hundreds of Deaths as Europe Struggles With Snow Amid an Intense Cold Snap
